meanings.definition: The process or act of combustion before the main combustion event.
meanings.sent1: The precombustion of the fuel in the engine helps in efficient burning.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the precombustion phase to understand the overall combustion process better.
meanings.sent3: The precombustion of the firewood made the campfire start faster than expected.
meanings.sent4: The precombustion of ideas in his mind led to a burst of creativity later on.
meanings.sent5: The precombustion of the rocket fuel created a mesmerizing display of flames and smoke.

meanings.sent1: The precombustion stage involves preparing the fuel for burning.
meanings.sent2: The precombustion temperature needs to be just right for a successful ignition.
meanings.sent3: The precombustion safety checks ensured the fire would start without any issues.
meanings.sent4: His precombustion rituals before starting the fireplace were meticulous and precise.
meanings.sent5: The precombustion smell of gasoline filled the air before the engine roared to life.
